alert.note: Alert for Apache; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 25 at 7:15PM MST until July 25 at 10:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... central Navajo County in north central Arizona... central Apache County in northeastern Arizona... * Until 1015 PM MST. * At 714 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated a large area of thunderstorms producing heavy rain from Wide Ruins to Polacca. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Keams Canyon, Greasewood Springs, Toyei, White Cone, Steamboat Canyon, Sunrise Springs, Steamboat, Cornfields Chapter House, Jeddito, Jadito, Klagetoh, First Mesa, Petrified Forest National Park, Navajo, Greasewood, Polacca, Navajo Reservation and Hopi Reservation. This includes the following highways... State Route 264 between mile markers 386 and 429. Highway 191 between mile markers 393 and 405. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Crazy Creek, Sabito Wash, Pueblo Colorado Wash, Big Dam Wash, Beshbito Wash, Bidahochi Wash, Lithodendron Wash, Ha-whi-yalin Wash, Leroux Wash, Dead Wash, Wepo Wash, Jeddito Wash, Keams Canyon Wash, Polacca Wash, Wide Ruin Wash, Bluebird Canyon Wash and Steamboat Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
